Build Successful 

https://jenkins.openbmc.org/job/ci-repository/70278/ : SUCCESS

Patch Set 19:

(7 comments)
Left in-progress comments.
please pass error codes by const reference.  This reduces the number of intermediate constructions.
Why are we default constructing a message object here?  Having a default arg in a constructor seems odd.
These are generally not what an error id would look like.  In normal openbmc dbus usage, an error would look like "xyz.openbmc_project.InvalidId" or something similar.

These are all fairly unsafe references.  Could we rearchitect these methods to simply take these as the first few arguments like we've done everywhere else, and remove the class entirely?

Having one class to verify all errors is a little worrisome, and not simple to trace.
lets avoid changing auto -> type in this case.  Although both are allowed, it's unrelated to the overall change.
?  This doesn't look related to error handling?
